titleStmt.title: The trades-man's jevvel: or a safe, easie, speedy and effectual means, for the incredible advancement of trade, and multiplication of riches; shewing how men of indifferent estates, may abundantly increase both their own and other mens trading and riches, without parting with money, or any stock out of their own hands: by making their bills to become current instead of money, and frequently to revolve through their hands, with as much in money as the sums therein mentioned do amount unto.
titleStmt.author: Potter, William.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed by Edward Husband and John Field, printers to the Parliament of England,

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
